intro: Palicourea parvijelskii, commonly known as the dwarf palicourea, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to Central and South America, particularly found in tropical regions of Brazil. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Palicourea parvijelskii is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along riverbanks.
